intro: Elatostema brunneinerve var. brunneinerve, commonly known as the brown-veined elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial with small, ovate leaves that have a distinctive brownish nerve pattern. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on slender pedicels. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
